definition: dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: The FBI wanted to storm them, too.
sentences.chinese: 联邦调查局当时也想对这些人发动强攻。

sentences.english: This paper, from the angle of awareness and training, analyses the reasons for"storm not strong".
sentences.chinese: 本文从认识上和训练上分析了强攻不强的原因。

sentences.english: It was them who took fortifications of Montmartre by assault, thus putting the Napoleon War to its end.
sentences.chinese: 就是他们强攻蒙马特，最后导致拿破仑战争结束。

definition: to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
